ovdesc.p: This file is used to record and maintain details of all securities opened within the Securities module. Comprehensive information relating to each Security, along with the conditions applicable to it, is stored in this file. There is a secondary master file called SECURITY.SUPP. This file is optional and is used to maintained additional information about each Security. The key to the two files is the same.

desc.p: Up to 2 type SSS (SWIFT A to \) characters. Input must be an ID of a COUNTRY record.
Details the name and particulars of the issuing or parent company.

This field may be expanded to allow the user to enter the security description in various languages. Each expansion of the field will correspond to a new language on the LANGUAGE table and will indicate to the user the language in which the COMPANY.NAME is to be entered.
1 - 35 Alphanumeric characters, free format description. Multilanguage field. (Mandatory input)
Indicates whether the Security is a subscription right granted to existing shareholders for a new issue of shares.
1 - 2 Alphabetic characters (Optional input - Default value is NO)
Only Y or NO can be entered in this field.
Can only be Y when SECURITY.TYPE field is S (Share).
Identifies the LIMIT REFERENCE number to be checked for limit control on Securities Issuer Limits.
The ISSUER field must be populated with a relevant customer number before input will be accepted.
A limit must be set up for the issuer with a limit amount allocated before input will be accepted.
For a limit to be active then relevant SEC.ACC.MASTER records (normally for the Banks own books) should have the CHECK.LIMIT field set to Y.
If the above conditions are met then limit checks will take place for all trades in this security for the relevant books.
If a limit is exceeded then OVERRIDE messages will be generated when the trade takes place.
When a valid limit reference is entered then on Authorisation Limits will be checked and updated for all trades in this security for the relevant books.
If a valid limit reference is removed or changed then limits will be backed out for the old reference for all trades in this security for the relevant books.

3 to 7 numeric characters limit reference code. (Optional input). Input in this field must be a valid limit reference number. If no limit exists with a limit amount allocated then an error message will be displayed. Multi valued associated with fields 82 (CUS.COMPANY) to 87 (MC.RESERV1)
This field may have a value of YES to indicate that the accrued interest will be included into the calculation of the CG PL
Or a value of NO to indicate that the accrued interest will not be included into the CG PL calculation.
Valid values YES or NO
Nulls treated like NO
Optional input
This field is used by AM.MODELLING during Rebalance process.
but in the event that the underlying security may be traded in fractions, then this field should be used to specify the number of decimals permissable.
1 to indicate that only whole numbers are allowable.
0 to indicate any amount of decimals up to and including 6 (therefore same as 0.000001)
0.1 only one decimal permitted (can be none)
0.01 up to and including 2 decimals (none, 1 and 2)
0.001 up to and including 3 decimals (none, 1, 2 and 3)
0.0001 up to and including 4 decimals (none, 1, 2, 3 and 4)
0.00001 up to and including 5 decimals (none, 1, 2, 3, 4 and 5)
0.000001 up to and including 6 decimals (none, 1, 2, 3, 4, 5 and 6)
A setting of 0.001 means that the underlying security may be traded, for example, 123.1 or 123.12 or 123.123 but not 123.1234.
Non Mandatory
AM.TRADING.UNITS should be a Multiple of ODD.LOT.UNITS.

This field captures the daily market capitalisation of the instrument. The market capitalisation is a product of the number of shares issued times the price. The data from this field is used by the AM.BENCH.INDICES application to calculate the performance of an instrument on a daily basis.

Specifies the Minimum holding for the security. The minimum holding entered here is checked against the transaction codes specified in MIN.HOLD.CHECK in SC.PARAMETER and if the total holding of the portfolio is less than the minimum holding, override is raised for transactions involving the specified transaction codes
Must be a multiple of trading unit and greater than the trading unit.
Indicates the tax code based on which tax is to be charged from the transaction on sale of this security.
1-5 Alphanumeric characters.
Must exist on the TXN.TAX.CODE file.
Multi-valued field to control the brokers that orders for this odd lot can be traded with.
This is an optional field. Blank is the default and if means that all brokers are allowed.
Any input in this field must exist in CUSTOMER.SECURITY with BROKER type.
Indicates whether the PAID.AMOUNT is a percentage figure or not.
Example: 1) If the PAID.AMOUNT field is 25.00 and the PAID.CODE field is %, then Security is 25% paid.
2) If the PAID.AMOUNT field is 25 and the PAID.CODE field is null then the security is 25 paid.
Valid input is % or Null. % - Meaning Percentage. Null - Meaning amount (Optional Input)
Specifies the system date on which the SECURITY.MASTER record was created.
Standard date format (No Input field)
Indicates whether this Security has a nominal value quoted in stock units as opposed to shares.
1 - 2 Alphabetic characters (Optional input - Default value is NO)
Only Y or NO may be entered in this field.
Reserved for future use.
NO INPUT.
Whether the instrument is recommended or not, can be STRONG.BUY, BUY, HOLD, SELL or STRONG.SELL.

This field will specify the coupon rate effective date. If this field is entered then the field INTEREST.RATE RATE.CH.DATE will be made Noinput fields. The usage of this field has been specified with an example given below:
CPN.DATE 14 APR 2000, CPN.RATE 8.00, CAP.RATE, FACTOR
CPN.DATE 14 APR 1998, CPN.RATE 5.00, CAP.RATE 3.00, FACTOR
CPN.DATE 14 APR 1996, CPN.RATE 4.40, CAP.RATE 4.60, FACTOR
CPN.DATE 14 APR 1994, CPN.RATE 4.00, CAP.RATE 4.00, FACTOR 1.10
Therefore the coupon rate on the 01 sept 98 would be 5%.
Must be descending
No Duplicate dates allowed
Total asset value, related to NAV.
The Country Code representing the country where the risk is deemed to reside for this security.
This field can be used for the generation of country risk information.
If no value is entered, then it is defaulted with the value in field SECURITY.DOMICILE.
Standard T24 AlphaNumeric Field.
Indicates the currency in which the security was issued and usually quoted.

This is the currency in which the security was issued. The currency may be traded in another currency and if so the trade currency is entered at deal input time. The field PRICE.CURRENCY (Field 10) is the currency that this security is normally traded.
Example: Volkswagen shares with a company domicile of DE, are issued in DEM but can be traded in CHF, GBP etc
3 Alphabetic (currency code) characters.
Must exist on the CURRENCY table.
Reserved for future use.
NO INPUT

The Foreign Inclusion Factor (FIF) of an instrument is a weighting assigned to an instrument that represents the proportion of shares outstanding that are deemed to be available for purchase in the public equity markets by international investors. In practice limitations on availablity include:
strategic and other shareholdings in an instrument
limits on foreign ownership.

The FIF is used by companies who compile indexes to provide a more accurate representation of company weighting in the index calculation. The contents of this field will be used by the AM.BENCH.INDICES application to provide a more accurate methodology of calculating indices. (NOT CURRENTLY DEVELOPED)
A value between 0 and 1 should be entered.
Defines the issue date of the Security.
This field is for international purposes only and is not used within T24 applications.
Standard date format. (Optional input)

Security description which will appear on display screens. As this field is limited to 35 characters only, the vital elements of the Security should be included. A concise name, abbreviated where necessary, interest rates and maturity dates for bonds and C.Ds and for equities whether fully or part paid, new or old etc.

This field may be expanded to allow the user to enter the security description in various languages. Each expansion of the field will correspond to a new language on the LANGUAGE table and will indicate to the user the language in which the SHORT.NAME is to be entered.
Example: Excheques 10 1/4% stock 1995 (GBP).
3-35 Alphanumeric free format characters. Multilanguage field. (Mandatory input)
The date after which dividends or coupons payable on this INT.PAYMENT.DATE become non transferable.
If a Security is traded after this date and before the INT.PAYMENT.DATE then negative interest is payable.
Standard date format. (No input field)
Indicates whether or not a safe custody charge is to be levied on this particular Security.
Field will always default to Y. In the event that the underlying security attracts no safe custody fees at all, you may enter N.
0 - 2 Alphabetic characters (Optional input but will default)
Default value Y.
Only Y or NO can be entered in this field.
If this field is set then the following formula would be used for interest amount calculation

INTEREST = NOMINAL * (((1+INT.RATE/100)^(INTEREST.DAYS/YEAR.DAYS))-1) where INT.RATE is from INTEREST.RATE in SECURITY.MASTER, INTEREST.DAYS is the number of day for which interest has to be calculated, YEAR.DAYS is the interest day basis from the SECURITY.MASTER
Input allowed only if BOND.ROUNDING is not set.
Allowed Input: Y or null
This field may have a value of YES to indicate that the expenses will be included into the calculation of the CG PL
Or a value of NO to indicate that the expenses will not be included into the CG PL calculation.
Valid values YES or NO
Nulls treated like NO
Optional input

1. Identifies shares of companies incorporated in the U.S.A or Canada, traded in London (dealt either in $ or ), with exception to Registered shares deliverable by transfer. 2. Identifies Foreign Currency Loans quoted in London but expressed or optionally payable in a currency other than that of a scheduled territory.
Note: Fields RIGHTS.FLAG to UK.FLAG can normally be identified by key words in the title of the Security concerned.
Enter either A or B where: A = Shares B = Loans Zero input indicates that this field is not applicable.
This is a multi valued field. Standard T24 numeric field.
A maximum of 35 characters may be entered.
This is a NOINPUT field.
This field indicates whether a non-zero position exists in any company for this security. If so it will be set to Y. If no positions exist or all positions are zero then the field will be NO.
This field is updated by a close of business job.
This field indicates whether to populate adjusted date or non adjusted date to be populated into RATE.CH.DATE field depending upon the business day.
Allowed values are maximum of five characters and minimum of one. First two characters should be a number. And last three characters should be ADJ denoting for adjustment which is optional
This field will be NOINPUT for SHARE type of security
First two characters should be equal to the date part of INT.PAYMENT.DATE
Specifies whether or not this Security is a Unit Trust.
1 - 2 Alphabetic characters (Optional input - Default value is NO)
Only Y or NO may be entered in this field.
Date from which all activity in this security is to be prohibited.
Standard date format - ddmmyy.
Indicates whether the Security is a NID.BOND or not.
If the field is set, then for a bond issued in the middle of the period which will have first odd period for interest calculation,
the year days will be arrived at by calculating the number of days from what would have been the start of the coupon period
if the bond had been issued prior to that. NID bond is applicable only when the day basis set to 'U'.
This field is set to:
- YES if the security number is an odd lot.
- NO if the security number isnt an odd lot.
- Null if there is no instruction (Security number can be an odd lot)

This field corresponds to the multiplication factor used for bonds that have factors associated with them. The multiplication factor will be used in the calculation of the consideration on security trades using the security in view.
Optional Input
Change to this field will be allowed only for those factors associated with effective dates in the future
0.00 will be a valid rate
If the CAP.RATE field has been entered then this field
may only be entered during intial setup of the security
for dates in the past. The factors in the future in this
case will be automatically calculated by the system.
For Trailer Fee
Field used to capture the index value used in the calculation of trailer fees.
The U.S. Cusip Identification number.
Can be specified as an alternate index.
The level of duplication, if any, for this field is specified in the SM.PARAMETER application.
0 - 12 Alphanumeric characters. (Optional input)
Reserved for future use.
Defines this Security is a CD (Certificate of Deposit).
This field is used when calculating stamp tax and EBV fees.
1 - 2 Alphabetic characters (Optional input - Default value is NO)
Only Y or NO may be entered in this field.
Identifies these bonds or securities as having their capital and interest payments guaranteed by a third party.
1 - 2 Alphabetic characters (Optional input - Default value is NO)
Only Y or NO may be entered in this field.
It will be check on demand in the asset management modelling with the no file enquiry AM.SCE.PREVIEW.SOO
Specifies the smallest nominal amount that may be traded.

Normally, for share type securities this will default to 1 but in the event that the underlying security may be traded in fractions, then this field should be used to specify the number of decimals permissable.
1 to indicate that only whole numbers are allowable.
0 to indicate any amount of decimals up to and including 6 (therefore same as 0.000001)
0.1 only one decimal permitted (can be none)
0.01 up to and including 2 decimals (none, 1 and 2)
0.001 up to and including 3 decimals (none, 1, 2 and 3)
0.0001 up to and including 4 decimals (none, 1, 2, 3 and 4)
0.00001 up to and including 5 decimals (none, 1, 2, 3, 4 and 5)
0.000001 up to and including 6 decimals (none, 1, 2, 3, 4, 5 and 6)
A setting of 0.001 means that the underlying security may be traded, for example, 123.1 or 123.12 or 123.123 but not 123.1234.
Optionnal.
Used to decide how the value in the NOMINAL.FACTOR field will be used when calculating the value of securities held or traded.
Divide - this will be used when the price is quoted per unit and the nominal is stated per security.
Multiply - this will be used when the price is quoted per security and the nominal is stated per unit.
Mandatory input when there is a value in the NOMINAL.FACTOR field.
Change not allowed after the security has been traded.
Date of new price to be applied, non-stop processing only.
Interest counter, applicable to shares only,Associated multivalue with INT.CTR.COUNTRY.
Accepts a valid country,applicable to shares only,Associated multivalue with INT.CTR
Duplicate of this field is not allowed and only the first multi value set can be null
If the company country is not sepcified then system will automatically consider the first multivalue set
Help Text for this field is unavailable. Please refer to the T24 User Guides for further information.
New discount yield to be applied, non-stop processing only.

The system calculates Group 1 holdings as at the start of the Equalisation Period (date of last unit trust distribution). All purchases from this date up until the end of the equalization period (ex-date) will be classed as Group 2 holdings.
This field dictates which Group (1 or 2) sales will be deducted from during the Equalisation Period.
null - The SUMLIFO option is used
FIFO - Uses the First In/First Out calculation for sales
LIFO - Uses Last In /First Out calculation for sales
SUMLIFO - Sums all the purchases sales then performs Last In/First Out Calculation for the result
DEFAULT - Copies the default setting from the SUB.ASSET.TYPE record
LIFO, FIFO, SUMLIFO or DEFAULT
Examples
1. In this example the first transaction we have is a sale followed by a purchase.
FIFO
This method will try reduce the Group 1 units first but if there is not enough Group 1 units, the remainder will be taken from Group 2 units.
LIFO
This method will try reduce the Group 2 units first but if there is not enough Group 2 units, the remainder will be taken from Group 1 units.
SUMLIFO

This method will sum all the purchase sales for the Equalisation Period then try to reduce the Group 2 units first but if there is not enough Group 2 units, the remainder will be taken from Group 1 units.
2. In this example the first transaction is a purchase followed by two sales.
This method will try reduce the Group 1 units first but if there is not enough Group 1 units, the remainder will be taken from Group 2 units.
LIFO
This method will try reduce the Group 2 units first but if there is not enough Group 2 units, the remainder will be taken from Group 1 units.
SUMLIFO

This method will sum all the purchase sales for the Equalisation Period then try to reduce the Group 2 units first but if there is not enough Group 2 units, the remainder will be taken from Group 1 units.

This field contains the Company Mnemonic of the Customer file relevant to the ISSUER of the security. In a multi company site it is possible to have more than one Customer file, so it is theoretically possible for the same issuer to have different customer numbers in different companies. Information which is customer specific such as ISSUER and LIMIT.REF will be associated with this field.
NO INPUT Multi valued associated fields 82 (CUS.COMPANY) to 87 (MC.RESERV1).
Specifies the smallest nominal amount that may be traded.

Normally, for share type securities this will default to 1 but in the event that the underlying security may be traded in fractions, then this field should be used to specify the number of decimals permissable.
1 to indicate that only whole numbers are allowable.
0 to indicate any amount of decimals up to and including 6 (therefore same as 0.000001)
0.1 only one decimal permitted (can be none)
0.01 up to and including 2 decimals (none, 1 and 2)
0.001 up to and including 3 decimals (none, 1, 2 and 3)
0.0001 up to and including 4 decimals (none, 1, 2, 3 and 4)
0.00001 up to and including 5 decimals (none, 1, 2, 3, 4 and 5)
0.000001 up to and including 6 decimals (none, 1, 2, 3, 4, 5 and 6)
A setting of 0.001 means that the underlying security may be traded, for example, 123.1 or 123.12 or 123.123 but not 123.1234.
1 - 16 Numeric characters (Optional input) Details. When inputting trades the nominal amount entered must be multiple of the value in this field.
The exception to this is when 0 to 0.000001 is entered. In which case the nominal amount entered can have decimal amounts in accordance with the descriptions above.
The default value for this field is 1.
Up to 4 type S (SWIFT) characters. Input must be an ID of a SC.INDUSTRY record.
Multi-valued field to control the stock exchanges where the odd lot security can be traded on.
This is an optional field. Blank is the default and it means that all stock exchange are allowed.
Any input in this field must exist in STOCK.EXCHANGE table.
Identifies any additional element which has been defined locally to meet a particular requirement.

As in the majority of T24 Applications, the User is allowed to define in this file up to 999 Local Elements in addition to the standard fields previously specified. These Local Elements should be defined by the User where deemed necessary according to local practice.

The name(s) of the new element(s), as well as the Format and
Validation Rules:, must be defined in the LOCAL.TABLE, prior to the creation of any records.

Up to 35 characters as defined in the Local Table definition for this Local Reference field. Multivalue field. (Optional or Mandatory input according to definition in the LOCAL.TABLE for this local reference element.)
As defined by the User within the LOCAL.TABLE and LOCAL.REF.TABLE.
If the field ODD.LOT is set up then this field should updated with :
- The odd lot if the field ODD.LOT is set to no
- The Security Number if the ODD.LOT set to YES

Field used to store the coupon associated with a particular denomination. This figure will be used to calculate entitlements where it has been entered. If the field is not entered then the INTEREST.RATE field will be used.
A Rate field
It stores the conversion price for options
1-15 Numeric characters
Mandatory when CALL.PUT.IND is specified.
Specifies the number of decimal places that will be used to round decimals in yield calculations.
Defines par value of the stock in the SECURITY.CURRENCY.
1-16 Numeric characters. (Optional input)
If the SECURITY.TYPE field is S(Share) then input becomes mandatory.
If the UNPAID.AMOUNT field and/or the UNPAID.CODE have been entered, input is mandatory.

Used to store the last (most recent) recorded price for this particular Security. These prices may well be automatically updated. For Yield OR discount price types, price cannot be manually input and price will be calculated based on DISC.YLD.PERC.
Note: On an option use premium.
1-15 Numeric characters. (Optional input)
Factor date, associated with Factor. Used only in AM exported time series data.

This field should be used to generate Entitlements based on Value Date. For a Value Date based Entitlement, all Security movements that have a Value date before the EX.DIV date (of the DIARY), will be included. All positions were the EX.DIV date is lesser than the Value Date will be ignored.
The System will default to this field for a TRADE or VALUE Date based Entitlement.
Optional input.
Input can be TRADE, VALUE or left Blank. Blank is equivalent to a TRADE date based Entitlement.
Indicates the date at which the last price was effective and is linked to the LAST.PRICE field. Again this field could well receive an automatic external input.
Standard date format (Optional input)
The value entered should satisfy the pre-requisites set up in ALT.SEC.PARAMETER
The value entered would be validated against the fields ID.FORMAT, MAX.LENGTH, MIN.LENGTH and DISPLAY.MASK
Defines the method of calculation for accrued interest on a Security be it a Bond, Gilt, Loan stock etc
Example: A = 360/360 where a standard 30 day month is assumed over 360 days a year, as is the case for all Eurobond calculations.
Note that O and U values are intended to enable the setting-up of French Oat and US Treasury Bills respectively.

For US Treasury (value = U), the number of days in the denominator vary according to the number of days in the interest period. For example, if the number of days in the interest period is 182 and the number of payments in a year is 2, then the denominator (i.e. basis days) would be 364. Similarly, if number of days in a interest period is 184, the base days would be 368.
For a basic fixed interest French Oat (value = O) and also for French BTAN issues, the process requires rounding within the calculation to the nearest THIRD decimal (0.0005 is rounded up)
For example :
An investor holds 10 000 securities of the 5.25%, 25 April 2008, OAT.
Full coupon per security: 0.05250 payable on 25 April 2000
Accrued interest calculation date: 24 March 2000
Number of days accrued: 334
Total number of days in the interest period: 366 (the O is actually hard-coded as ACT/ACT basis)
Calculation :
Therefore :
Accrued interest in percentage: 4.791%
Total amount of accrued interest paid in euro: 479.10
NOTE :

Please refer to the BOND.ROUNDING field on this file, the two files UNIT.INT.METHOD and BOND.ROUNDING to enable greater control over rounding of interest. Your User Guide explains the processes in greater detail to help you decide.
Alphabetic character. (Optional input)
If BOND.OR.SHARE is B input is mandatory, regardless of whether an interest rate is specified. If left blank an unreliable yield figure will be calculated. If BOND.OR.SHARE is S input is not allowed.
Only A, B, C, D, E, F, G, O or U can be entered into this field.
If G is entered then the NO.OF.PAYMENTS field must be either 1, 2, 4, 13, 26 or 52.
Specifies the maturity date of the Security.
This field can be changed only if the CALCULATION.METHOD of the PRICE.TPYE record specified in the PRICE.TYPE field is not YIELD, DISCOUNT, YPRICE or DPRICE.
Note: For various reasons, such as, management reports, redemptions, partly paid shares etc it is important to include, wherever possible, the maturity date.
Standard date format. (Optional input)
This field accept value YES. If this field is set to YES then security is considered as restricted stock and field MARGINABLE should be set to NO.
The security value for these stocks will be calculated using the diversified margins specified for these stocks, provided they are held in a diversified portfolio.
If the field is not set,then the margin value of these stocks will be zero.
HDB security id.

Field used to store the coupon associated with a particular denomination for the first coupon period. This figure will be used to calculate entitlements where it has been entered. If it is not entered then the field COUPON.PRICE will be used.
A Rate field

This input for this field is determined in the application SM.PARAMETER, if the field PRICE.QUAL.FORMAT is not SWIFT then the only valid input for this field is xd, otherwise the list of valid entries will be determined from the fields CUM.INDICATE and EX.INDICATE in the same application.
If the entry is xd then it indicates that the the price quoted in the LAST.PRICE or DISC.YLD.PERC field is ex-dividend.

Otherwise it indicates the price condition, as specified by SWIFT, for example CDIV indicates the price is cum dividend, XWAR indicates the price is ex warrants. The user should consult the SWIFT manual for a full list of price conditions.
Input only allowed if the security price is updated manually otherwise this field is updated by the external price field.
If PRICE.QUAL.FORMAT is not SWIFT then the only permissible input is xd (Lowercase only - UPPERCASE not allowed)
If PRICE.QUAL.FORMAT is SWIFT then entry will be limited to values from CUM.INDICATE and EX.INDICATE on SM.PARAMETER.

This field stores the elapse days between interest rate changes. Based on the frequency defined in this field, Rate changes would automatically be populated by expanding the INTEREST.RATE and RATE.CHANGE.DATE fields
INPUT allowed only when COUPON METHOD is SIMPLE or COMPOUND.
Valid input are nnD,nnW and nnm
This field indicates whether INTEREST.RATE to be populated are BID.RATE or OFFER.RATE from PERIODIC.INTEREST table for FRN Bonds
Allowed values are BID or OFFER
This field will be NOINPUT for SHARE type of security
This field contains a YES or a NO signifing whether or not to use the PAR.VALUE field in the calculation of interest. If set to NO a value of 1 will be used.
Valid values are YES or NO
Indicates if the Security is an Investment Loan type Security.
1 - 2 Alphabetic characters (Optional input - Default value is NO)
Only Y or NO may be entered in this field.

Day convention to be used when calculating the Value Date for any corporate actions for this security. This is the convention to be used when finding a working day in all the countries listed in the BUS.CENTRES field.

This field will be used by the applications DIARY, DIV.COUP.DET, REDEMPTION.DET and STOCK.DIV.DET to calculate a working day value date from the defaulted value date of the corporate actions event if this defaulted date is a non-working day in all the countries listed in the BUS.CENTRES field.
Optional field. Any input must be FOLLOWING, MODIFIED or PRECEDING.
These inputs have the following meanings;
FOLLOWING The value date will be the first working day that follows the defaulted date.
PRECEDING The value date will be the first working day that precedes the defaulted date.

MODIFIED The value date will be the first working day that follows the defaulted day unless it falls in the next calendar month, in which case the value date will be the first working day that precedes the defaulted date.
If this field is left blank then the value date used will be the defaulted date.
Optional input.
Any input must be FOLLOWING, MODIFIED or PRECEDING.
Field indicates whether Individual Principal (IP) details are to be stored for this security.
YES or NO
Can only be set to YES if the security has not been traded and the field CG.BASE.UPDATE in SC.PARAMETER is YES.
This field will contain the ID of the security that has been replaced by this security master record.
No Input Allowed
Input to this field can be any one of the following ALL, COUNTRY code prefixed by C-, BIC CODE prefixed by B-, SC.AGENT.PLACE id prefixed by A- or any free format narrative.
This field will allow maximum of 15 characters and it is not a mandatory field.
While committing a SEC.TRADE or SECURITY.TRANSFER the value from this field will be taken to build SSI key and if this field is null then it will be taken as ALL.
Help Text for this field is unavailable. Please refer to the T24 User Guides for further information.
Indicates the percentage margin allowable on this Security.
If not entered, the margin allowed for the SUB.ASSET.TYPE will be used.
Example: 70 = 70% Margin (stock is worth 70% face value for Client valuation purposes).
1-5 Alphanumeric characters. (Optional input)
Must exist on the MARGIN.CONTROL file.
Field used to store the denominations (certificates) in which this security is traded.
Must be entered in ascending order
Values entered must be a multiple of TRADING.UNITS.
Indicates whether the secuirty is a Bond or Share type.
This field defines whether the security is a share or a bond.
This field is used when calculating stamp tax and EBV fees.
Allowed values are B or S, where B = Bond and S = Share. (Mandatory input)
Only S or B may be entered in this field.
Specifies the usual currency of in which the Security is traded. Normally the same as the SECURITY.CURRENCY.
Note: This currency code can be overridden at Transaction level but for normal trading purposes this is the currency which will be used.
3 Alphabetic (currency code) characters. (Mandatory input)
Must exist on the CURRENCY table.
This field stores the Previous Coupon Start Date for the Instrument defined. This is updated Automatically during the start of day of the coupon payment during the cycling of the dates.
This field is updated automatically is a NOINPUT field.

This is the percentage rate applied to customers holdings in the SECURITY.POSITION file to come up with a base figure for safecustody charges. Once this figure has been derived the portfolio percentage SAFEKEEPING.PERCNT from the SEC.ACC.MASTER is applied to this figure to come up with the final safecustody charge.
0 - 14 Numeric characters
This determines if special rounding calculations will occur for the accrual of interest on bonds.
If answered YES the system will determine if there is a rounding method applicable display it in the BOND.ROUND.TABLE field.
YES or NO
This field contains the ID of the security that has replaced this security master record.
No Input Allowed

If the proposed nominal is greater than AM.MIN.ROUNDING during AM.COMPARE, order will be generated for the min.rounding.units. The orders generated will be in multiples of trading units set in SECURITY.MASTER.
No orders will be generated if the proposed nominal is less than AM.MIN.ROUNDING during AM.COMPARE
For ex: Prescribed nominal through AM.COMPARE is 15 and min.rounding.units is 10 and the trading unit is 12. Then order will be generated for 12.
From the above example, suppose the trading unit is 2. Then orders will be generated for 14 units.
The date at which the INTEREST.RATE changed or is due to change.
This is the date the associated interest rate is effective to.
Standard date format. Multivalued field associated with INTEREST.RATE (Optional input)
International security identification number.
Can be specified as an alternate index.
The level of duplication, if any, for this field is specified in the SM.PARAMETER application.
1-12 Alphanumeric characters. (Optional input)
First two characters must be alpha characters for the Country code, No validation against the country table in T24.
The next nine characters must be alpha-numeric for the National Security Number.
The last one is a check digit from 0 to 9, which will be validated against Modulus 10 Double Add Double Algorithm.
This field get validated only when ISIN.VALIDATION field in SC.PARAMETER is set to YES.

This field will be associated with the CPN.DATE field and will be used to specify the coupon rate for the period defined by the date. If this set of fields are used they will be used to populate an INTEREST.RATE in that field.
Optional Input
Must be entered if the CPN.DATE has been entered.
Specifies the Stock Exchange to be used for automatic price feeds.

With many pricing services there are a variety of different prices available from different stock exchanges. The user may use this field to specify which stock exchange to take automatic price feeds from.

(e.g. A Stock may be listed on the Zurich, Basle and Geneva stock exchanges at end of day each of these prices is likely to be different. This field specifies that despite the fact that the STOCK.EXCHANGE field is Zurich the Basle price is to be requested from Telekurs).
1 - 5 Alphanumeric characters (Optional input)
Must exist on the STOCK.EXCHANGE table.
Total units outstanding on the fund. Populated by the system during NAV calculation process. No-input field. Standard T24 nominal / amount ( NOMAMT) format.

This field will accept 0-9 Numeric characters with maximum of 6 decimal places preceded by either plus or minus sign values. This value will be either added or subtracted from INTEREST.RATE field for the adjustment to ensure the correct all in rate
Allowed values are 0-9 Numeric Characters with + or - sign. Sign is not mandatory
This field will be NOINPUT for SHARE type of security
For Trailer Fee
Field used to capture the initial ref level value used in the calculation of trailer fees.
Identifies the group of like Securities, which are reported together.
Example: 100 = share type security 200 = option type security 300 = fixed rate security.
Could be the sub asset types opened for equities, options and government securities.

If the SUB.ASSET.TYPE is changed the user is prompted whether they want to rebuild the associated portfolio valuation data online or at end of day. The system will not allow the SUB.ASSET.TYPE to be changed from a structured instrument type to a non structured instrument type as defined in the SUB.ASSET.TYPE application.
1-5 Alphanumeric characters (Mandatory Input)
Must exist on the SUB.ASSET.TYPE table.
Specifies the industry to which this Security belongs.
1-4 characters. (Mandatory input)
The Industry Code must exist on the SECURITY.INDUSTRY file.
This field can be set to:
- BUY
- SELL
- BOTH
for an odd lot trade, it indicate if the security can be bought only, sold only or both.
Contains a detailed description of the Security. It should contain information relating to rates, payment, expiry, maturity dates and all aspects peculiar to that Security.
As this field provides the description which will appear on clients advices it is important that it be as precise as possible.

This field may be expanded to allow the user to enter the security description in various languages. Each expansion of the field will correspond to a new language on the LANGUAGE table and will indicate to the user the language in which the data is to be entered.
3-35 Alphanumeric characters. Multi value field. Sub valued for language. (Mandatory input)
No.of records in ALT.SEC.PARAMETER corresponds to the no.of multi values of ALT.SECURITY.ID
E.g. If there are two live records in ALT.SEC.PARAMETER, then the no.of multi values of ALT.SECURITY.ID would be two.
NOINPUT field
Record should exist in ALT.SEC.PARAMETER
Reserved for future use
No input field only used by the system if the Bon de Caisse module has been installed.
No input field.
YES/NO field used for cycling the coupon period. If YES is specified, the next interest payment date would be the last day of the month computed as per the frequency specified in NO. OF PAYMENTS,
Input allowed only for bonds.
YES/NO/Blank allowed. Blank would be considered NO
Field shows the method used in updating the RATING field
Input can be either:
Default is Manual
No input is allowed if the RATING field is left blank
Indicates whether or not the Security opened is a warrant, i.e. an entitlement to purchase stock or bonds up to a specified period and at a specific price.
1 - 2 Alphabetic characters (Optional input - Default value is NO)
Only Y or NO can be entered in this field.
Y can only be entered when the RIGHTS.FLAG field is NO.
Internal Identification number
This is a user specified Security identification number
This field is supplied for notational purposes only.
1-18 Alphanumeric characters. (Optional input)
Narrative the user wishes to be displayed in the override when a blocked security is used.
Free format message- alpha-numeric.
Issue price.

Field used to store the coupon associated with a particular denomination for the last coupon period. This figure will be used to calculate entitlements where it has been entered. If it is not entered then the field COUPON.PRICE will be used.
A Rate field

This field will correspond to the capitalisation rate to be used for bonds that capitalise a portion of the coupon interest payable. The effective interest rate on the bond will therefore always be equal to this rate plus the rate in the INTEREST.RATE field. This rate will be used to calculate that portion of the coupon interest that will not be paid out to the customer and instead will be capitalised to the principal amount. As a result of the capitalisation the factor on the bond will increase and hence the value of the nominal holding will increase in turn. The factor in this case will be calculated using the following formula :
FACTOR = (LCV + CI)/NOMINAL Where :- LCV - Last Capitalised Value CI - Current Capitalised Interest
Optional Input
Change allowed only if associated with a future date
Standard T24 rate field.
A maximum of 10 characters may be entered.
Defines the calculation method to be used when calculating the price of a trade.
Example: SHARE = Ordinary Share Price = amount x 1 BONDS = Percentage Price UNIT = Multiply by factor of 10.
1-5 Alphanumeric characters (Mandatory input)
Must exist on the PRICE TYPE file.
Specifies whether or not the Security is a Debenture.
1 - 2 Alphabetic characters (Optional input - Default value is NO)
Only Y or NO may be entered in this field.
Defines the latest yeild or discount market price for the underlying security.
Depending on the CALCULATION.METHOD on the PRICE.TYPE file, a percentage may be entered here and the LAST.PRICE field will be updated.
upto 16 numeric characters may be entered including six digits after the decimal point. (Optional input)
If the calculation method is not YEILD or DISCOUNT then input is not allowed.
Specifies whether or not the Security is officially quoted at the particular STOCK EXCHANGE. If not quoted, it may be traded O.T.C (over the counter) or U.S.M. (Unlisted Security Market) etc.
1 - 6 Alphabetic characters (Optional input - Default value is NO)
Only QUOTED, LISTED or NO may be entered in this field.
Asset type of the instrument.
This field may have a value of YES to indicate that the expenses will be included into the calculation of the CG PL withheld tax
Or a value of NO to indicate that the expenses will not be included into the CG PL withheld tax calculation.
Valid values YES or NO
Nulls treated like NO
Optional input
Indicates whether the security is a FRN Bond.

Allowed values are STANDARD, SIMPLE, COMPOUNDor Null, where STANDARD, SIMPLE and COMPOUND = indicates FRN Bond and NULL value = Not a FRN bond. If SIMPLE or COMPOUND, then rate changes would take place in between coupon period in the frequency as defined in RATE CHANGE ELAPSE field

If the COUPON.METHOD is entered as STANDARD,SIMPLE or COMPOUND then the fields BUILD.CPN.DATE, INTEREST.KEY, RATE.SELECTION are mandatory. RATE CHANGE ELAPSE is mandatory when COUPON METHOD is SIMPLE or COMPOUND
This field will be NOINPUT for SHARE type of security
This would be the total asset value of the fund calculated for the previous day.This is the overall value and not NAV per unit.No-input field. Standard T24 Amount format.
Identifies partly paid stocks or shares and the amount paid in SECURITY.CURRENCY.
1-12 Numeric characters. (Optional input)
Specifies the interest rate payable on any Security.
Where the interest rate for the next interest period is known it may be entered in successive multi value.
0 - 11 Numeric characters. Multivalued field associated with RATE.CH.DATE (Optional input)
If the SECURITY.TYPE field = B, input is mandatory (but 00 is allowed for zero coupon bonds etc).
If the SECURITY.TYPE is S input is optional.
Risk level, defined by EB.LOOKUP table from RISK.LEVEL.

The date of the income amount. Will default to the current system date if the INCOME field is changed but no change is made to this date field. Again this field can be input or updated by a price feed.
Automatic input.
This is a multi valued field. Standard T24 alphanumeric field.
Mandatory input.
A maximum of 35 characters may be entered.
Specifies the country domicile of the Security being issued. This need not necessarily be the same as COMPANY.DOMICILE (See Example below.)
Example: Kingdom of Greece 9% Loan stock sterling issue. COMPANY.DOMICILE = GR (Greece). SECURITY.DOMICILE = GB (Great Britain).
2 Alphabetic (country code) characters (Mandatory input)
Must exist on the COUNTRY table.
Defines the key to the SC.CALCULATE.CPN table where additional information relating to coupons or bonds may be stored.

When trading a bond the price is calculated using the interest day basis in this SECURITY.MASTER file, however, when calculating coupons using the DIV.COUP.CUS application, the system will use the interest basis defined in the SC.CALCULATE.CPN record where this exists.
0 - 5 Alphanumeric characters (Optional input)
Must exist in the SC.CALCULATE.CPN table.
The income amount currently applicable to the security. This field can be input or updated by a price feed.
Numeric input.

Multi-valued field containing a list of the countries to be used when calculating the value date to be used for corporate actions for this security. See the helptext for the DAY.CONVENTION field for the rules used by T24 when calculating a working day for the value date.
Any input must exist on the COUNTRY file. A particular country can only be entered once. Will default to the country input into the COMPANY.DOMICILE field if no input has been made.
Any input must be a valid COUNTRY code.
Will default to the COUNTRY code input in the COMPANY.DOMICILE field.
Duplicate Country Codes are not allowed.
Field to indicate the number of decimal places to which the Individual Principal (IP) value is to be calculated to.
Must be an Integer in range 0 to 9
Can only be 9 if extended precision is being used (See SPF field EXTENDED.PREC).
Reserved for future use.
This field is purely for guidance only.
If the BOND.ROUNDING field is set to YES there is a bond rounding method applicable to this Security then the rounding method will be displayed in this field.

Be aware that this field is dynamically updated, therefore each time SECURITY.MASTER is accessed the system will check to see if there is a better bond rounding method update it accordingly. Each time a bond rounding calculation is performed the system will not look at the SECURITY.MASTER record to determine the rounding method but will select the best method at the time of the calculation.
NOINPUT field
Field to indicate whether or the the price quoted in the LAST.PRICE or DISC.YLD.PERC field is ex-dividend or not. If this field is xd then the price is ex-dividend.
Input only allowed if the security price is updated manually otherwise this field is updated by the external price field.
If input is allowed the only permissible input is xd (Lowercase only - UPPERCASE not allowed)
This field holds a time period that is to be used to treat a purchase after a sale of a security as a reacquisition of the security.
Reacquisition of a security can trigger a situation that drops that loss associated with the sale transaction.
Mandatory input if the REACQ.DROP.LOSS field has been entered.
Must be of the format nnD, nnB, nnW, nnM, nnY. Where:
nn - number of the days
D - Calendar Days
B - Business Days
W - Weeks
M - Months
Y - Years
This field defines the Issuer of the security. No Portfolio Limit Per Issuer is performed if this field is null.
10 digit CUSTOMER id (Optional input field) Part of Multi Value Association 82 (CUS.COMPANY) to 87 (MC.RESERV1)
No input field only used by the system if the Bon de Caisse module has been installed.
No input field.
The equivalent Sedol Security number.
Can be specified as an alternate index.
The level of duplication, if any, for this field is specified in the SM.PARAMETER application.
0 - 12 Alphanumeric characters. (Optional input)
This field defines whether or not the Security in question is a Mutual Fund.
0 - 2 Alphabetic characters (Optional input)
Only Y, NO or null may be entered in this field.
Tax codes applicable when trading this security.
This field may have a value of YES to denote that the loss will be dropped on reacquisition of a security
Or NO if the loss will not be dropped.
Valid values of YES or NO
Input mandatory if the REACQ.PRD field is entered
Nulls is treated like NO
Original yeild.
The redemption price of the security. Only allowed for Bond instruments.
Specifies the depository in which this particular stock is to be kept.
Note: The user may override this Depository at transaction level.
1-9 Numeric characters. (Optional input)
The depository must exist on the CUSTOMER.SECURITY file and must have a CUSTOMER.TYPE Depository.
Nominal factor used for price calculations, the value entered in this field will override any value entered in the MULTIPLY.FACTOR field on the PRICE.TYPE record attached to the SECURITY.MASTER.
1-9 numeric or . characters.
Mandatory input if there is a value in the FACTOR.TYPE field.
Amendment will not be allowed after the security has been traded.
This field is used to determine the lead time required for the new rate reset. It determines the interest rate Next fixing date
Allowed values are 0-5 and it is a non mandatory field
This field will be NOINPUT for SHARE type of security
New price to be applied, non-stop processing only.
Contains a unique short code for each Security. It is used for easy reference, identification and quick information retrieval.
Example: New Zealand 10% 10/72003 Mnemonic = NZ10100703 International Bank Reconstruction and Development, FRN 2003. Mnemonic = IBRDFRN03
3-10 Alphanumeric characters. (Mandatory input)
2-10 free format.
Must be a unique number.
No spaces allowed.

Records the date from which accrued interest, coupons and dividends are payable (normally the issue date). When used in conjunction with the INT.PAYMENT.DATE field tells the System that Interest is to be calculated from accrual date to payment date.
This is effectively the last interest payment date.

If the SUB.ASSET.TYPE relating to this record has its field KASSENOBLIGATIONEN set to YES then you may leave this field blank. In this case, when entering a SEC.TRADE, for example, you will be requested to enter the accrual start date on the transaction yourself
Standard date format. (Optional input)
If a value has been entered in the INT.PAYMENT.DATE field, then input is mandatory.
The accumulated income applicable to the security. This field can be input or updated by a price feed.
Numeric.
This field is reserved for future use.
A NOINPUT field

This field accepts two numeric values. When the percentage of price change, for the security is greater than ALERT.PRICE.PERC, then an alert will be sent to the portfolio owner, if the portfolio has subscribed for price movement alert.
Interest counter date, associated with interest counter.
Factor, associated with KFACTOR.DATE. Used only in AM exported time series data.
Flag indicating whether the instrument is a floating rate note or not.
For Trailer Fee
Issuer of the security for whom the trailer fee is being calculated.
Specifies when a Security ceases to be valid, whether repaid, redeemed or expired (Call and Put Options). This is important for bonds and CDs etc. which have a finite life period.
Standard date format. (Optional input)

The date at which the shares will go Ex dividend. If the shares are sold before this date then they are sold Cum dividend i.e. including any dividends that may be accrueing to those shares, after this date then the reverse is true.
Standard date format. (Optional input)
This field will control the trading unit for the odd lots. This field will be used in Corporate Actions and Odd lot orders in order to do the rounding of the nominal.
Optional Input
1 - 16 Numeric characters including up to 6 decimal places. When inputting the nominal amount entered must be multiple of the value in this field.
The exception to this is when 0 is entered. In which case the nominal amount entered can have decimal amounts up to 6 decimal places.
Specifies the number of coupon or interest payments a year.
Numeric input where allowed values are 0.2, 1, 2, 3, 4, 6, 12, 13, 26 or 52.
Default is 1.
If the number of payments entered is 13, 26 or 52 then the INTEREST.DAY.BASIS must be G.
Defines the credit rating of the Security.
0 - 5 Alphanumeric characters (Optional input)
Must exist on the EB.RATING table

Specifies the date on which the 1st interest payment or coupon falls due. If the future date is not known then enter the last date interest was paid. The system will calculate the next payment date in conjunction with NO.OF.PAYMENTS at the authorisation level of the dividend payment record.
This is effectively the Next Interest Payment date.

If the SUB.ASSET.TYPE relating to this record has its field KASSENOBLIGATIONEN set to YES then you may leave this field blank. In this case, when entering a SEC.TRADE, for example, you will be requested to enter the next interest payment date on the transaction yourself.
Standard date format.
If the INTEREST.RATE field has a value then this field becomes a mandatory input EXCEPT when the securitys SUB.ASSET.TYPE field KASSENOBLIGATIONEN is set to YES.
Must not be after the maturity date.
Tax basis for calculating tax due, either FIFO, LIFO or AVERAGE.
Defines this Security as being a promissory note or not.
1 - 2 Alphabetic characters (Optional input - Default value is NO)
Only Y or NO may be entered in this field.
A maximum of 17 characters may be entered.

This would be the NAV adjusted for exit load and portfolio charges, i.e. the price at which units would be redeemed. This field would be automatically updated by the system during the NAV calculation process. No-input field. Standard T24 Price format.
Indicates whether or not the Security has to be registered under the Clients name.
Normally these conditions will be specified at Transaction level. Any input at SECURITY.MASTER level can be overridden.
1 Alphabetic character. (Optional input)

Maximun of 32 characters is allowed
The equivalent Cedel Security number.

Standard T24 CCY field.
Indicates whether Security is convertible i.e. exchangeable for a predetermined amount of stock in another form.
1 - 2 Alphabetic characters (Optional input - Default value is NO)
Only Y or NO can be entered in this field.
Refers to the Stock Exchange at which the Security is normally traded.
1-5 Alphanumeric characters. e.g. GB = Great Britain, BS = Basle, ZH = Zurich. (Mandatory input)
Must exist in the STOCK.EXCHANGE file.

The equivalent Swiss Valoren number.

0 - 10 Alphanumeric characters (No Input field)
Indicates whether the Security is a Government Issue i.e. a Treasury Loan Stock, Exchequer Stock etc or a Municipal issue i.e. Local Government bond, Liverpool, Cardiff etc.
1 Alphabetic character (Optional input - Default value is N)
This field may have one of three values. G - GOvernment Stock M - Municipal Bond N - Neither
This field accepts either five alpha characters or ID of existing PERIODIC.INTEREST table. From the next interest payment cycle, system will update with the ID of PERIODIC.INTEREST table.
Allowed values are (1) Either first two characters should be a number from 00 to 99 and last three characters should be a valid currency (2) Or the id of PERIODIC.INTEREST table
This field will be NOINPUT for SHARE type of security
Field used for Part Paid securities where the amount that is unpaid is included in the price.

The value entered in this field will be taken into account when calculating the value of securities held or traded, the price used in this calculation will be the price entered less the unpaid amount.
Numeric input only, if the PRICE.TYPE attached to the security is a percentage price, then can only be in the range 0 to 100
Must be less than the value in the LAST.PRICE field.
Can not be changed after the security has been traded.
Identifies each separate Security and/or any related Security.
For pricing purposes, numbers should correspond with their Telekurs equivalents to ensure correct update with respect to external price feeds e.g. 123456 - 000.
1-6 numeric characters Security number separated from 3 suffix numeric characters by -. (Mandatory input)
Must be a unique number within the system. Leading 0s will be automatically filled.
After authorisation a Security mnemonic code may be entered here to speed up input.
Reseved for future use.
NO INPUT

Specifies the type of price update that will update the price of this security. Will validate against the PRICE.UPDATE file.Once record is authorised, If the AUTO.UPDATE.REQD flag on the PRICE.UPDATE record linked to this SECURITY.MASTER record is set to Y earlier and now then both the LAST.PRICE and DATE.LAST.PRICE fields cannot be amended.
1-5 uppercase alpha or numeric characters. (Mandatory input)
Must exist on the PRICE.UPDATE file.
Indicates the tax position regarding the interest, coupons, dividends etc.
This field is used to define whether interest, coupons, dividends etc., are taxed, non taxed, net of tax etc.
1-5 Alphanumeric characters. (Mandatory input)
Must exist on the COUPON.TAX.CODE file.
The equivalent Euroclear Security number.
Can be specified as an alternate index.
The level of duplication, if any, for this field is specified in the SM.PARAMETER application.
0-12 Alphanumeric characters. (Optional input)
Specifies the country of domicile, of the parent company or government or establishment issuing the Security.
This field is used when calculating stamp tax and EBV fees.
Note: Care should be taken as COMPANY.DOMICILE need not be the same as SECURITY.DOMICILE.
2 Alphabetic (country code) characters. (Mandatory input)
Must exist on the COUNTRY table.
Issuer to be used for performing issuer diversification checks. Input to be prefixed with I- for entering issuer from SC.ISSUER. Input to be prefixed with C- for entering T24 customer
Allowed value YES and can be set if security is classified as exception for diversification.
Allowed options are YES ,MX and NULL . YES indicates that the message MT502 will be sent from order through SWIFT. MX will generate MX message from order instead of SWIFT message.
Allowed only valid Customer security id of the type Broker. This field will be mandatory while STP field is set.
Allowed option are YES or NULL . YES will Indicate whether the execution should be flagged for halt.
Allowed option are YES or NULL . YES will indicate if the authorisation of the trade should be halted.
Indicates the percentage of loss margin allowable on this Security.
If not entered, the margin allowed for the SUB.ASSET.TYPE will be used.
Validation Rules
1-5 Alphanumeric characters. (Optional input)
Must exist on the MARGIN.CONTROL file.
A field to determine if a bond has an average life associated with it.
Allowed values are Y or Null (Blank)
Input allows only if field FACTOR is set and BOND.OR.SHARE equals to B
A field indicating the average maturity date of the underlying instruments (e.g. Mortgages)
This field can either be input by the user OR calculated by the system if the WEIGHTED.AVG.LIFE has a value.
Input allowed only if AVG.LIFE is set to ‘Y’
This date should be greater than TODAY and less than the MATURITY.DATE.

A numeric field indicating the number of years for the average life of the underlying instruments.The integer portion of this number represents the number of years and the decimal portion of the number is that portion of the year.
If this field is set, the system automatically recalculates the AVG.LIFE.MAT.DATE using the formula
WEIGHTED.AVG.LIFE * 365 days + current date.
For example, assume the weighted average is 1.16 and the current date is April 17, 2018.
The average life maturity date is calculated as
This is then rounded to 423.This represents 423 days.
The AVG.LIFE.MAT.DATE would then be calculated as April 17, 2018 + 423 which is Jun 14, 2015.
This date should be greater than today and less than the MATURITY.DATE.
Market rate to calculate the NPV based on future cashflow information.
Validation Rules
The field can either be a Fixed rate or PERIODIC.INTEREST key with prefix P
Margin to calculate the NPV based on future cashflow information
Validation Rules
The field can either be positive or negative.
Input is optional
This field is part of associated multi value set from TRADE.CCY to ALT.SEC.NO.
Input allowed only if ALT.INDEX.CHK in SM.PARAMETER is set.
The field is used to list the various currencies in which the security can be traded in.
Validation Rules
The value of this field should be a valid currency
This field is part of associated multi value set from TRADE.CCY to ALT.SEC.NO.
This field defines the exchange associated with the trade currency above.
This field is a sub value field
Input allowed only if ALT.INDEX.CHK in SM.PARAMETER is set
The value of this field should be a valid record in Stock exchange
The alternate security identifier (as defined in ALT.SEC. PARAMETER) can be specified in this field
The alternate identifier, if any, needs to be entered manually in this field and it will be validated against the defined alternate
identifiers (in ALT SEC PARAMETER).
Valid ID in ALT.SEC.PRAMETER
The alternate security reference for the identifier defined in the above field, ALT.SEC.ID
The Alt Sec ID and Alt Sec No will be associated sub-value fields.
e.g. ALT.SEC.ID RIC.CODE
ALT.SEC.NO HPHT.SI
Fields from Trade Ccy to Alt Sec No. will be associated multi-value fields.
Alphanumeric characters.
To indicate that the record is for the primary market. If there are multiple SM records with the same ISIN, the
record
(e.g. the USD counter security. Hutchison Port Trust) with the primary market flag set will be considered the primary security
and this means that the security currency (i.e. USD) of this record will be considered as the primary currency (i.e. USD).
Set to Y or Null
DEF - Defaulted ,mainly for bonds where coupon payment is defaulted. Trading can still continue. No override message or hard block by the system
DEL - Delisted ,when security is delisted from exchange, it is also expired and no more trading can be done
for this security. System will raise an override message, validating against the status date for any transactions on or after
the status date
SUS - Suspended , when security is suspended with an effective date, no more trading is allowed. System
should provide an override message, validating against the status date for any transactions on or after the status date.
Allowed Values are DEF,DEL and SUS
This field will indicate the date from which the SEC.STATUS is effective.
Valid Date format
Flag the Security is Expired, The field can be set to ‘Y’ where the security is expired
Flag the instrument is traded as scrip(as opposed to scripless). The field can be set to ‘Y’ where required
This field will indicate date of inception of the fund
This field will indicate the issuer of the fund (i.e. the name of the issuer)
This field will indicate the Advisor(s) to the fund
This field will indicate the Sub-Advisor(s) to the fund
This field details the Name of the fund manager(s)
Denotes the countries in which the fund is registered
The trustee of the fund
Free format field to define any market categorization/classification for the fund (based on investment objective, risk profile, etc.)
Free format field to define any sub-category/classification for the fund
Denotes whether fund is open ended or close ended (Open or Close)
Validation Rules
Allowed Values are OPEN and CLOSE
Denotes whether it is a direct fund or Fund of Fund (Direct or FOF)
Validation Rules
Allowed Values are DIRECT and FOF
Field to indicate whether the fund is a hedge fund or not.
Allowed value is YES or NO
Field to indicate whether the fund is an exchange traded fund
Allowed value is YES or NO
Field to indicate whether fund uses derivatives as part of its investment or not
Allowed value is YES or NO
The applicable currencies linked to the fund
3 Alphabetic (currency code) characters.
Must exist on the CURRENCY table.
This field is to denote the initial issue size of the fund in security currency
This field indicates the initial fund offer closure date
Multi-value free format to list any restriction(s) applicable (e.g. No redemption for 60 days, open only to institutional investor)
Flag to indicate whether the fund is closed for all investors
Allowed value is YES or NO
Flag to indicate whether the fund is closed for new investors
Allowed value is YES or NO
Maximum stated management fee (expressed in percentage)
Maximum stated admin fee (expressed in percentage)
Currency related to minimum amount (investment/redemption) fields below
3 Alphabetic (currency code) characters.
Must exist on the CURRENCY table.
This field indicates the amount of initial investment
This field indicates the amount of subsequent investment
This field indicates the minimum SIP amount.
This field indicates the minimum redemption amount. The fields MIN.INVT.CCY till MIN.REDEM.AMOUNT will be associated multi-value fields
This field indicates the Highest NAV in last 12 months
This field indicates the Lowest NAV in 12 months

This field will hold the security to which the position has to be credited, when the execution happens for the fund, where the NAV is not known. The value in this field will default to UPFRONT SEC in SEC OPEN ORDER for credit transactions.
When the order is executed, the trade will be created for this security.
This field will accept valid SECURITY MASTER ID
Setting this Field to 'YES', indicates that this instrument is a structured note.
Allowed Value 'YES',If null to be defaulted from sub asset type STRUCTURE.NOTES field
This field is applicable only for structured note instruments
This field will allow specification of the issuer name without the need to have an ISSUER customer record
1 - 35 Alphanumeric characters, free format
This field is applicable only for structured note instruments
This is used to specify the option strategy linked to the structured product.
This attribute is applicable to all variants of structured note. Recorded only for information purposes.
1 - 50 Alphanumeric characters, free format
This field is applicable only for structured note instruments
Security Master ID that will be the underlying for the note.Associated multivalue
This field will accept any valid SECURITY MASTER ID.
This field is applicable only for structured note instruments
The underlying need not necessarily be a security – it can be a currency, commodity, index or any such.
This field will be used to specify the underlying – it can be a currency ID, DX CONTRACT MASTER ID or any free format definition for the underlying.
Associated multivalue with UNDERLYING.
1 - 35 Alphanumeric characters, free format
This field is applicable only for structured note instruments
It will be the short name from Security Master if it is a securities underlying or a free format description if any other.
Associated multivalue with UNDERLYING.
1 - 35 Alphanumeric characters, free format
This field is applicable only for structured note instruments
If the underlying is the SM ID, this will be the ISIN.
Associated multivalue with UNDERLYING.Recorded only for information purposes.
1 - 12 Alphanumeric characters, free format,If the underlying is security master then ISIN will be defaulted from SM.
This field is applicable only for structured note instruments
This is the Spot price of the underlying.
This will not be automatically updated based on Last Price in SM as this is expected to be received from the issuer.
Associated multivalue with UNDERLYING.
1-16 Numeric characters
This field is applicable only for structured note instruments
Strike price of the assoiciated underlying,This field is used for information purposes.
Associated multivalue with UNDERLYING.
1-16 Numeric characters
This field is applicable only for structured note instruments
If a single underlying is linked to a note, the weight will be assumed to be 100%.

However, it will be possible to link multiple underlying instruments (basket) in which case this will be the weight of each underlying. The total weight should be 100%.Recorded only for information purposes.
Associated multivalue with UNDERLYING.
This field is applicable only for structured note instruments
Price barriers are set up in SC.NOTE.PRICE.BARRIER.TYPE and attached here. Example of price barriers could be KNOCK OUT, STOP LOSS, BONUS LEVEL etc.
Since the records are user-defined, any type of price/barrier information can be recorded.
Associated subvalue with UNDERLYING.
A valid record in SC.NOTE.PRICE.BARRIER.TYPE
This field is applicable only for structured note instruments
If the price or barrier level has to be automatically calculated based on spot price of the associated underlying, the percentage can be specified here.
Associated subvalue with UNDERLYING.
This field is applicable only for structured note instruments
Manually updated or auto calculated and denotes the price of the price barrier. For example, for KNOCK OUT barrier, this would be KNOCK OUT price.
Associated subvalue with UNDERLYING.Recorded only for information purposes.
This field is applicable only for structured note instruments
The date on which barrier levels are reset. For e.g. stop-loss price for mini-futures will be reset by the calculation agent periodically
This will generally be the last day of the month (if not a working day, the next business day).
This field will be rolled over automatically based on frequency set (in next field).
Associated subvalue with UNDERLYING.
A Valid Date.
This field is applicable only for structured note instruments
This will be the frequency at which reset date will be rolled over
Associated subvalue with UNDERLYING.
This field is applicable only for structured note instruments
A value of 'YES' in this field indicates that the associated price barrier is breached. This field is used for information purposes only.
Associated subvalue with UNDERLYING.
Allowed value is 'YES' or 'NO'.
This field is applicable only for structured note instruments
This field records the date of the price breach.
Associated subvalue with UNDERLYING.
A Valid Date
This field is applicable only for structured note instruments
A value of Yes Indicates that Worst-of feature is applicable for this intrument.Generally used for a basket of underlying
Recorded only for information purposes
Allowed value is 'YES' or 'NO'.
This field is applicable only for structured note instruments
The date from which the note is available for investment (earliest). If not specified, this will be assumed to be the issue date.
Override will be generated if the value date of the trade is earlier than the investment date
A Valid Date
This field is applicable only for structured note instruments
The date(a certain number of days prior to maturity) when the fixing will be done to determine the payout.
Any pay-out processed before this date will result in a system override
A Valid Date
This field is applicable only for structured note instruments
A value of YES indicates that this is a digital variant of Prinicipal protected product
Recorded only for information purposes
Allowed value is 'YES' or 'NO'.
This field is applicable only for structured note instruments
A percentage of the investment amount that will be the all-in-cost applicable to the structured note instrument.
This will cover financing cost, issuance cost, etc. Used to calculate the ALL.IN.COST in the SEC.TRADE transaction
This field is applicable only for structured note instruments

This can be either set to Inclusive (if yes, it is assumed that All in cost is part of the issue price and the system will calculate and store the all in cost only for information purposes at trade level)
or Exclusive (in which case, it is assumed the cost is not part of issue price and will be calculated and posted in Misc Fees field of the trade to be posted)
Allowed Value : YES,NO
This field is applicable only for structured note instruments
If set to Yes, the All in cost will be calculated for the issuer (broker/counterparty) side of the trade and posted in BR MISC FEES field of the trade.
Allowed Value : YES,NO
This field is applicable only for structured note instruments

This field records how the spot price of the underlying is monitored against the barrier levels. If set to Maturity, the knock-out or barrier comparison will be done at maturity. If set Continuing, the knock-out /barrier will be tracked throughout the lifecycle.Recorded only for information purposes.
Allowed values MATURITY_CONTINUING.
This field is applicable only for structured note instruments
This field is used to record leverage applicable for products like mini futures
This field is applicable only for structured note instruments
This is auto-calculated based on Spot Price and issue price (Spot/Issue = nX)
This field is applicable only for structured note instruments
Specifies the percentage of the capital that is protected
Recorded only for information purposes
This field is applicable only for structured note instruments
This is to denote the participation level on the upside over strike
Recorded only for information purposes
This field is applicable only for structured note instruments
This is applicable for a product like twin-win certificate where the investor receives the invested amount plus the percentage in the downside movement of the underlying
Recorded only for information purposes
This field is applicable only for structured note instruments
This is to denote the percentage above strike that is used to cap the maximum returns
Recorded only for information purposes
This field is applicable only for structured note instruments
This is applicable only with a knock-out feature (on Principal protected products) to specify the percentage above strike that the investor will receive in case of knock-out
Recorded only for information purposes
This field is applicable only for structured note instruments
This field is applicable for Capital protection notes. The dates on which the coupon will bee observed to check for cap/floor levels.
Recorded only for information purposes
A Valid Date
This field is applicable only for structured note instruments
If set, the coupon observation date will be auto rolled over based on this frequency
If the date happens to be a holiday, the rollover will be to the next business day.
This field is applicable only for structured note instruments
This is the cap rate of coupon applicable for capital protection notes with coupon.
Recorded only for information purposes
This field is applicable only for structured note instruments
This is the floor rate of coupon for capital protection notes.
Recorded only for information purposes
This field is applicable only for structured note instruments
This is the start of the range for Range accrual notes product
(e.g. if the Euribor is in the range of 2 to 3% on all days, then coupon rate will be 5%.
Based on this example, this field will be set as 2)
Recorded only for information purposes
This field is applicable only for structured note instruments
This is the end of the range for Range accrual notes product
(e.g. if the Euribor is in the range of 2 to 3% on all days, then coupon rate will be 5%.
Based on this example, this field will be set as 3)
Recorded only for information purposes
This field is applicable only for structured note instruments
Reference for annual coupon (e.g. 3 month Euribor)
Recorded only for information purposes
This field is applicable only for structured note instruments
This is to specify whether a Memory feature is applicable. Applicable for memory notes
Recorded only for information purposes
Allowed value YES or NO.
This field is applicable only for structured note instruments
For products like mini futures, a formula can be specified which will be a term sheet element but not used for any calculation.
Recorded only for information purposes
This field is applicable only for structured note instruments
The routine defined in this field will be invoked at the time of Note pay out processing.The logic within the routine can be used to arrive at the pay out price
if left blank, the value would default from SUB.ASSET.TYPE pay out routine field
This field is applicable only for structured note instruments
This field is used to record the credit event that has occurred. This field is applicable to credit linked notes.
Allowed values COUPON DEFAULT_PRINCIPLE DEFAULT
This field is applicable only for structured note instruments
Indicates the occurrence of the credit event specified in the CREDIT.EVENT field.
Recorded only for information purposes
Allowed value YES or NO.
This field is applicable only for structured note instruments
This field captures the date on which the credit event has occurred.
Recorded only for information purposes
A valid id.
Allowed options are YES and NULL
If the value specified is YES then the transactions involving these securities will be exempted from FTT(Financial Transaction Tax)
This field is applicable only for structured note instruments
Percentage of the Initial investment the investor will receive in case of principal default credit event.
Recorded only for information purposes
